alert.note: Alert for Bryce Canyon Country; South Central Utah; Southern Mountains (Utah) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 15 at 2:14PM MDT by NWS Saltlake
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Garfield County through 245 PM MDT... At 213 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 10 miles northeast of Bryce Canyon National Park, or 23 miles west of Escalante, moving southeast at 10 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Henrieville, Bryce Canyon National Park and Tropic. This includes Utah Route 12 near mile marker 19, between mile markers 28 and 33, and between mile markers 44 and 49. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. This storm may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.

area.areaDesc: Bryce Canyon Country; South Central Utah; Southern Mountains
